alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Logan (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 10:40AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN CHAMPAIGN AND LOGAN COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 AM EDT... At 1040 AM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located near Russells Point, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Bellefontaine, West Liberty, North Lewisburg, Russells Point, De Graff, West Mansfield, Quincy, Huntsville, Woodstock, Valley Hi, Zanesfield, Cable, Logansville, New Jerusalem, Pickrelltown, Lippincott, Middleburg, Mcmorran, Springhills and Mingo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
